pullRequest.title: [no ticket][risk=no] use services instead of dao in ConceptSetsController
pullRequest.bodyText:
In ConceptSetsController

removing ConceptDao and injecting ConceptService(has ConceptDao)
removing ConceptSetDao and injecting ConceptSetService(has ConceptSetDao)
refactored TO_CLIENT_CONCEPT_SET Function to be a normal method
refactored FROM_CLIENT_CONCEPT_SET Function to be a normal method

nodes.bodyText: IYI, MapStruct may be able to help here. It generates the obvious fields and lets your specify the nontrivial stuff.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -436,4 +363,65 @@ private DbConceptSet getDbConceptSet(
     }
     return conceptSet;
   }
+
+  public static ConceptSet toClientConceptSet(DbConceptSet dbConceptSet) {
+    return new ConceptSet()
+        .etag(Etags.fromVersion(dbConceptSet.getVersion()))
+        .lastModifiedTime(dbConceptSet.getLastModifiedTime().getTime())
+        .creationTime(dbConceptSet.getCreationTime().getTime())
+        .description(dbConceptSet.getDescription())
+        .id(dbConceptSet.getConceptSetId())
+        .name(dbConceptSet.getName())
+        .domain(dbConceptSet.getDomainEnum())
+        .participantCount(dbConceptSet.getParticipantCount())
+        .survey(dbConceptSet.getSurveysEnum())
+        .creator(
+            dbConceptSet.getCreator() != null ? dbConceptSet.getCreator().getUsername() : null);

nodes.bodyText: Ideally the DbConceptSet should handle finding an empty collection and return an empty Iterable. It makes me a little bit nervous to see the call site have to do basic checks like this.
nit: you can also do Optional.ofNullable().ifPresent(etag -> setEtagStuff(etag));.
Yeah, just a little check for empty and return an empty collection.
Why not return Optional<DbConceptSet> instead of throw when it's not found?
